conversations.content: Please note that this story contains spoilers for Chapter 21 of the main campaign.
Is that...Zethia?
Yes. I have returned.
And I shall use the power of Bahamut to take up arms alongside you!
We have seen many battles since that day.
And now that I have received Bahamut's power, a new foe has risen to face my brother's forces and I.
We now fight the Progenitor, one of the two creators of this world. We fight him for the very soul of the world itself.
Everything has been affected by the Progenitor's resurrection. Not a corner of the world remains untouched or unchanged.
In the midst of our battle, my brother and I were separated once more. But no matter how sad that parting, we refused to give in to despair.
We have faced uncountable hardships these last years, yet we continue to fight back and believe in the possibility we have left to us.
Eeek!
You okay?!
My leg hurts!
I know it hurts, but we have to run or they're going to catch us!
...Oh no! They're here! Hurry!
*pant* *pant* No... I can't...
AAAAAAAH!
Are the two of you all right?
You're...
The other villagers are hiding in a forest just ahead. Can you dig deep and find the strength to run but a bit farther?
*pant* Okay... I can do it...
It is but one more push from here. Now run, children. Run like the wind!
Aren't you coming with us?
Sadly, I still have work to do here. But I pray to join you apace.
But—
I know the Goddess will see you safe. Now go!
C'mon. We'll run together.
Not one step farther, you fell beasts!
I have not even begun to fight! Haaaah!
There is no end to them, but they are still no match for the power of Bahamut!
Phew!
Geez, lady! I came as quick as I could, but it looks like I still missed all the fun.
Did you get the villagers to safety, Ilia?
Sure did—including those two moppets you sent my way.
Fine news indeed. In that case, we can—
Oh, come on! MORE of these guys?! I don't know how long we can keep this up.
I agree. In which case...
The only way to win is to retreat!
*pant* *pant* I really worked up a sweat with all that running. Wish those guys would just take it easy for once.
Anyway, it's a bit, uh, dusty, but home sweet home, I guess! Just go ahead and plop down wherever.
I take it this is one of your hideouts. How many do you have?
Uhhh... Wow, that's a good question. But I'm kind of all over the place, so I'm pretty sure the answer is ＂a lot.＂
But in other news, I've figured out where your brother and his friends are.
You have?!
I sure have, sister. Apparently the villagers we just helped evacuate actually talked to ol' Euden.
Is he all right?! Where is he now?!
Easy there! This all happened a few days ago, so we don't know where he is at this exact moment.
If only we had reached the village a touch sooner...
Look, don't beat yourself up. It's true we don't know where they are at the moment, but we have a very good idea where they're all heading.
Tell me!
We may have been separated during the battle at the Sacred Tree, but our goals have always been aligned.
Which means we're all moving on pretty much the same path.
And this village we just passed through is the same one he came through earlier.
Which means...
Yep! We're all heading to Grams.
With the resurrection of the Progenitor, the world is proceeding down a path of ruin. Sinister mana enveloped everything, creating natural disasters and inciting fiends to madness.
In such a situation, it's only natural for people to seek safe haven—and the Holy City of Grams was one such destination.
And with more people comes more information. So in order to get through the battle, our priority became building our forces while gathering as much of that information as we could.
And however far they were from us, it was clear that Euden's party felt the same.
That's why we decided to hurry our little legs and meet 'em in Grams. But fate has a very annoying way of turning plans on their heads...
That appears to be the last of them. You can come out now, sir.
Thank you so much for saving me!
We merely happened to be in the correct place at the correct moment.
Yeah, but we lost time because of it. If we don't hustle our buns, we won't reach our destination before dark.
Yes, we should make haste and catch up to my brother.
Wait!
Look, I know you only just saved me, and I know how selfish this sounds...
But please, you have to save my family! They're still back in the village!
Tell us more.
Our village was attacked by those fiends, and we didn't have weapons or any fighters who could face them.
So you ran off hoping to find help in another town?
Exactly. Clearly not much of a plan, seeing as how those fiends would have torn me apart if not for you, but somehow I'm still here.
I can tell you have the power to drive the fiends from our village, so please come back with me and save my family!
Where is your village located?
Southwest of this forest. If you follow the river, you'll get there in half a day.
(Which is the exact opposite direction of Grams. We'll lose a full day if we do this, and we're already up against the clock...)
Very well.
Uh, do you maybe want to think about this for a hot second?!
My brother would never abandon someone in need, and I will not either.
Ooookay. Your call.
This must be the Goddess's blessings at work. Thank you so much—to you AND to Her!
Look at these chumps struttin' around like they own the joint.
There's not that many, so let's split up and and pick 'em off. You ready?
Fully so.
Then on my mark. Ready...GO!
That's the leader! Hurry up and dispatch it so we can get on with business already!
Huh?! Aw, crap!
Haaaah!
Are you all right, Ilia?
Thanks to you I am. You're the best partner a girl could ever ask for!
Yet still not so skilled with the blade as Mordecai.
Are you kidding me? I feel invincible when I'm fighting with you!
There. The village should be safe now.
I know this is a good thing, and we should be happy about it, but...
Do you regret that we went out of our way to help these people?
I just... I don't know? I think we did the right thing. We certainly didn't do the WRONG thing, if that's what you mean, but I'm still all full of doubts.
I mean, there are tons of people around the world who are suffering in this exact same way, right?
We'll never be able to help them all if we do it piecemeal like this, so maybe it's better for us to focus on the big picture. Er, but not that I regret it! It's just...
Ugh. Sorry. I'm all spun up about this.
Take heart, Ilia.
The fact you are worried about what may come is proof we have yet to be bested by the Progenitor.
No matter how difficult or painful the situation—and no matter how fraught with worry we become—we continue to believe in possibility. We do so because we must.
And that is exactly how we fight against the world the Progenitor seeks.
Wow, you really have a head for this deep kind of stuff, huh? I can see why you're the Goddess's chosen Auspex.
There is no need to tease me so— especially as you ARE the Goddess!
...Pfft! Ha ha ha!
Thanks, Zethia. I feel much better.
I was so worried about how we couldn't tell what the future might have in store, I was starting to get tunnel vision.
No matter what happens, we have the possibility of hope inside us—and we'll use that to fight for a better future.
If we doubt that potential and turn our eyes from the righteousness we swore to protect, the Progenitor wins.
Exactly. In order to defeat the Progenitor, we must believe the possibilities we have now can lead to even better possibilities in the future.
Hey, I like the sound of that!
In that case, let's get back out there and forge us some new possibilities!
No! Wait!
Are you really leaving in the middle of the night? We haven't even had a chance to thank you properly!
Sorry, but we've gotta get to Grams.
Grams?!
Look, if you're heading to Grams, just take this boat down the river. It'll get you there in half the time.
Seriously? That'd be a HUGE help.
You saved our village—I'd give you a dozen boats if I could!
And here we have an example of one possibility leading to another.
Yep. The world's a pretty rough place, but I won't give up on it yet!
Now let's get going already!
No...
Look at all the dragons... It seems Grams is right in the middle of this war.
We must save the people!
It can't be. They're all...
The fiends and dragons who attacked them are being influenced by the Progenitor. We have to stop it.
Look! Someone still fights just there! Lend me your aid, Ilia!
No... This can't be...
Not you, Elisanne! No! You can't die!
I'm afraid there are more over here...
Ranzal? Cleo? THIS CAN'T BE HAPPENING!
I swore I would fight! I swore I would protect you! And now...and now...
Um...Zethia? What are you doing?
I won't let them die! I won't give up! There's ALWAYS a possibility!
Zethia, stop. ...Stop.
STOP IT!
No! Why are you doing this?!
She's gone, Zethia—they're all gone. You can't bring back the dead.
No! There's still a chance!
QUIT USING POSSIBILITY TO HIDE FROM REALITY!
The potential we believe in isn't something that shields us from reality. Those people? They're dead. That's just a fact.
But...but it's not...!
HYAAAAH!
Wait, was that—?!
Zethia, wait!
It can't be! Why is he here?!
Euden!
Zethia?! Thank the Goddess you're safe!
Did you see Elly and the others? They were supposed to guide the townspeople to safety.
She... All of them are...
...I see.
In that case, we need to fall back. But as long as we draw breath, there's still hope—so we'll live on and forge new possibilities in the future!
Well said, Brother!
Guys, he's about to attack!
Let's give him the same beatdown we gave him a thousand years ago, Zethia!
We cannot! We lack the prayers of the people as well as fonts of holy mana!
If we are going to do this, we need Bahamut's power!
Mommy? Where's my mommy?
NO!
ZETHIAAAAA!
Mommy? Where's my mommy?
NO!
ZETHIAAAAA!
No, Euden! NOOOO!
Stay with me! I'll heal you!
Ze...thia... I'm sorry...
No! Please no! This can't be happening! IT CAN'T BE HAPPENING!
I...I didn't...
Kiddo, if you can still run, get outta here as fast as those stick legs can carry you.
Okay!
Zethia, you have to hold it together. I know this is harsh, but we don't have time to cry. We have to go—now.
AAAAAAAGH!
Zethia?!
Dammit! I have to help her!
How could you let yourself fall so far, Elysium?!
Have you forgotten the promise we made?! How you swore to protect this world?!
AAAAAAAAAAAH!
Ilia! Haaah!
Hold on. I'm healing you. Just hold on. I cannot lose you. Not now...
Heh... Guess that was pretty stupid of me, huh...?
That sinister mana... The effects of the Progenitor are making them stronger.
I underestimated how much tougher they are than us. I...I don't think we can win.
There is another option.
I have hope—a hope that will lead us to a future of possibilities. So right now, I want you to run and leave this to me.
Did this hopeless situation make your mind decide to up and fly away?! What can you do by yourself?!
You said that no matter how difficult or painful things were, we'd keep believing in better possibilities. Did you forget that?
I have not forgotten, and I don't intend to cast my life aside. Instead, I am taking the one path that offers us a future.
What do you—
Ugh! Could you scaly jerks please leave us alone for two freakin' seconds?!
Time grows short, Ilia. Now take this blade.
This is the blade that's supposed to resonate with the power of Bahamut and keep it from going out of control. Why are you giving it to me?
If you lose control of Bahamut's power and he tries to get out, he'll tear you apart! And if you shapeshift into him, you'll die!
I know.
We cannot escape this nightmare with the shadow of Bahamut I can currently summon with my half-fulfilled pact. But if I were to shapeshift into him...
It will buy enough time for you to escape to another world!
Nngh... Ilia, take this blade to another world...and create new possibilities!
Zethia!
Do it while I'm still in control! Believe in me! You are the only one who can carry this forward!
I can't! It's too much!
HURRY!
OH, FINE! Forcing connection of opposing poles! Bypassing region loads and rejections! Forcing the gate open!
I swear to you, Zethia—I will take the potential you created and use it to create a brighter future!
Mana sequential phase transition linked! Absolute coordinates fixed! Bypassing countdown! OPENING THE GATE!
Ilia... Thank you for everything...
ZETHIAAA!
Zethia...
There's too much I have to do, and far too much to think about...
That sound... That sensation... Possibility is ending. The world the Progenitor wants is almost here.
The future of that world is disappearing into a prison of black where nothing can be seen and nothing can ever reach it. It's an event horizon.
The blade glows... I understand, Zethia. I don't want to give up on that world either.
So I'm going to fight to bring a world of possibility back to you. I swear it!
Remember your promise, Nedrick. Tell my brother what you have learned, and listen to what he has to say.
Very well.
Zethia, get off the altar! Now!
What...? My body...!
Zethia, what's wrong?!
GRAAAAAAAGH!
Nnngh...
You! What are you doing here?!
You're Ilia!
Heya, Zethia! It's been a while— a thousand years, if I'm not mistaken.
Yes. Which is why I entrust this blade to you.
Is it special somehow?
It's...
Just a little something I brought with me from another world—and a thing that will resonate with the power of Bahamut.
With the dragon's blood, this blade, and your powers as an Auspex...
You'll be able to steal Nedrick's pact.
But whatever you decide, I promise to respect your decision unconditionally.
My decision...
Can I really do it? Everyone's always fought for me while I remained on the sidelines.
You'll be fine, Zethia. You're not some weakling who can't fight for herself.
I know for a fact that no matter how hopeless things get, you never break.
And I know you'll never stop moving forward no matter what.
You're someone who can choose her own path, so just believe in your own potential!
That resolve is going to lead us to a better future. I know it.
I understand—and I will not permit the possibilities you have entrusted me with to be wasted.
Thank you, Ilia.
...I promised I would.
Hmm? You would what?
Oh, nothing. Just talking to myself.
(Zethia, I promise to take care of the possibility you created.)
Now let's get going so we can protect our hope and our future.
Yes! We'll believe in this possibility and use it to create even more!
